original: bdag gi dbang po rnams kyang nyams par 'gyur /
analyzed: bdag gi dbang po rnams kyang nyams par 'gyur /
translated: my faculties will be impaired.

original: bdag gi bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor yang gzi brjid med par 'gyur /
analyzed: bdag gi bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor yang gzi brjid med par 'gyur /
translated: My face will be without luster.

original: gzugs phun sum tshogs pa thob par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzugs phun sum tshogs pa thob par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: I will not attain the perfection of form.

original: gzugs phun sum tshogs pa gang gis byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: gzugs phun sum tshogs pa gang gis byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: “If I do not have the perfect form with which to practice the bodhisattva way,

analyzed: sems can rnams kyis bdag mthong ma thag tu bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then as soon as sentient beings see me, they will not be certain of highest genuine full Awakening.

original: gzugs phun sum tshogs pas sems can yongs su smin par yang mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gzugs phun sum tshogs pas sems can yongs su smin par yang mi 'gyur /
translated: I will not be able to bring sentient beings to full maturity.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par mi 'gyur /
translated: I will not be able to purify a Buddha-field.

original: de ltar na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: de ltar na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par ga la 'gyur /
translated: In that case, how could I attain the knowledge of all aspects?

original: gal te bdag le lo can du gyur na byang chub sems dpa'i lam sgom par yang mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te bdag le lo can du gyur na byang chub sems dpa'i lam sgom par yang mi 'gyur /
translated: If I were lazy, I would not be able to practice the bodhisattva way.

original: sems can yongs su smin par yang mi 'gyur /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par yang mi 'gyur /
translated: I would not be able to bring sentient beings to full maturity.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par mi 'gyur ;
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par mi 'gyur ;
translated: I would not be able to purify a Buddha-field.

original: brtson 'grus ma brtsams na 'di ltar sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: brtson 'grus ma brtsams na 'di ltar sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If I do not begin to make an effort, I will not be able to complete the qualities of a Buddha.

original: de ltar gyur na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par yang ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par yang ga la 'gyur /
translated: How then could they attain the knowledge of all modes?

original: gal te bdag gi sems rnam par g-yengs par gyur na rnam par g-yengs pas ni ting nge 'dzin thams cad yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te bdag gi sems rnam par g-yengs par gyur na rnam par g-yengs pas ni ting nge 'dzin thams cad yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur /
translated: If their minds are distracted, they will not perfect all the concentrations,

original: sems can yongs su smin par yang mi 'gyur /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par yang mi 'gyur /
translated: they will not bring beings to maturity,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par mi 'gyur te /
translated: and they will not purify a Buddha-field.

original: de ltar gyur na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par ga la 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar gyur na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par ga la 'gyur ro //
translated: How then could they attain the knowledge of all modes?

original: gal te bdag thabs mi mkhas pa dang shes rab 'chal par gyur na nyan thos kyis @52b dang ; rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las 'das te sems can rnams yongs su smin par byas nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyangs te /
analyzed: gal te bdag thabs mi mkhas pa dang shes rab 'chal par gyur na nyan thos kyis @52b dang ; rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las 'das te sems can rnams yongs su smin par byas nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyangs te /
translated: If they are unskilled in means and have bad wisdom, they will not pass beyond the level of the Disciples and the level of the Pratyekabuddhas, and will not bring beings to maturity, and will not purify a Buddha-field,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya bas mi slob ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya bas mi slob ste /
translated: and will not fully know the supreme enlightenment.

original: de la bdag 'di ltar yang dag par slob ste /
analyzed: de la bdag 'di ltar yang dag par slob ste /
translated: I will train in this way:

original: bdag gis ser sna'i dbang gis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par mi bya ba dang / tshul khrims ngan pa'i dbang gis tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / gnod sems kyi dbang gis bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: bdag gis ser sna'i dbang gis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par mi bya ba dang / tshul khrims ngan pa'i dbang gis tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / gnod sems kyi dbang gis bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: It would be wrong for me to fail to perfect the perfection of generosity due to stinginess, to fail to perfect the perfection of moral discipline due to immorality, to fail to perfect the perfection of patience due to malice,

original: le lo'i dbang gis brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / rnam par g-yengs pa'i dbang gis bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab 'chal pa'i dbang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par mi bya ba 'di ni mi rigs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: le lo'i dbang gis brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / rnam par g-yengs pa'i dbang gis bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab 'chal pa'i dbang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par mi bya ba 'di ni mi rigs par 'gyur te /
translated: to fail to perfect the perfection of effort due to laziness, to fail to perfect the perfection of concentration due to distraction, and to fail to perfect the perfection of wisdom due to poor wisdom.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par ma byas /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par ma byas /
translated: I will not fail to perfect the perfection of generosity.

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par ma byas par rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes dran pa skyed par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par ma byas par rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes dran pa skyed par byed do //
translated: Similarly, without having completed the perfection of morality, patience, perseverance, concentration, and wisdom, they will not attain emancipation in the knowledge of all aspects.

original: koo shi ka de ltar rigs kyi bu'am /🔽rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dzin cing 'chang ba dang / klog cing kun chub par byed pa dang / 'dri bar byed pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed cing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems dang yang ma bral ba de dag gis tshe 'di dang /
analyzed: koo shi ka de ltar rigs kyi bu'am / rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dzin cing 'chang ba dang / klog cing kun chub par byed pa dang / 'dri bar byed pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed cing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems dang yang ma bral ba de dag gis tshe 'di dang /
translated: “Kauśika, it is like this:🔽those sons of a good family or daughters of a good family who take up, bear in mind, read aloud, master, and properly pay attention to the perfection of wisdom, and who are not separated from the thought of the knowledge of all aspects, will obtain the benefits in this life and in other lives.”

original: tshe rabs gzhan gyi phan yon rab tu 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni lam la rjes su shes pa yin te /
analyzed: tshe rabs gzhan gyi phan yon rab tu 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni lam la rjes su shes pa yin te /
translated: This is the subsequent knowledge with regard to the path.

original: 'di dag gis ni byang chub sems dpa'i mthong ba'i lam gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag gis ni byang chub sems dpa'i mthong ba'i lam gsungs pa yin no //
translated: These explain the path of seeing of the bodhisattva.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: When this had been said, Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams yongs su dul ba dang nga rgyal ma mchis pa'i don du nye bar gnas pa ngo mtshar che'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams yongs su dul ba dang nga rgyal ma mchis pa'i don du nye bar gnas pa ngo mtshar che'o //
translated: “Lord, it is wonderful how this perfection of wisdom has been set up for the sake of the full purification and the non-arrogation of the bodhisattva-mahāsattva!

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said:

original: koo shi ka ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams yongs su dul ba dang nga rgyal med pa'i don du @53a * //🔽nye bar gnas pa yin /
analyzed: koo shi ka ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams yongs su dul ba dang nga rgyal med pa'i don du @53a * //🔽nye bar gnas pa yin /
translated: “Kauśika, how has this perfection of wisdom been set up for the sake of the full purification and the non-arrogation of the bodhisattva-mahāsattva?🔽Kauśika, here the bodhisattva-mahāsattva, having stood in the perfection of wisdom, should train in the perfection of giving.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Blessed One having said that, Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said this to him:🔽“Blessed One, here bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of giving in the mundane world give gifts to the Blessed Buddhas, the Solitary Sages, and the Hearers.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'jig rten pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / nyan thos rnams la sbyin pa yongs su gtong bar bgyid cing de 'di ltar bdag ni sangs rgyas rnams dang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'jig rten pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / nyan thos rnams la sbyin pa yongs su gtong bar bgyid cing de 'di ltar bdag ni sangs rgyas rnams dang /
translated: Thinking, ‘I give gifts to the Buddhas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / nyan thos rnams dang / nyam thag pa rnams dang / 'gron po dang ; slong ba rnams la sbyin pa yongs su gtong ngo snyam nas de thabs mi mkhas pa'i sbyin pa des nga rgyal du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / nyan thos rnams dang / nyam thag pa rnams dang / 'gron po dang ; slong ba rnams la sbyin pa yongs su gtong ngo snyam nas de thabs mi mkhas pa'i sbyin pa des nga rgyal du 'gyur ro //
translated: bodhisattvas, Solitary Sages, Hearers, the destitute, travelers, and beggars,’ they become proud with that giving, which is not skillful means.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de 'jig rten pa'i tshul khrims bsrung zhing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de 'jig rten pa'i tshul khrims bsrung zhing /
translated: That bodhisattva mahāsattva will guard mundane morality.

original: bcom ldan 'das bdag ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di lta bu la spyod do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di lta bu la spyod do //
translated: Blessed One, I am practicing this perfection of morality.

original: bdag ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do snyam ste /
analyzed: bdag ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do snyam ste /
translated: I am perfecting the perfection of morality.’

original: de des nga rgyal du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de des nga rgyal du 'gyur ro //
translated: They become proud because of that.🔽That bodhisattva mahāsattva will cultivate mundane patience.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de 'jig rten pa'i bzod pa sgom par byed cing bcom ldan 'das bdag ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'di lta bu la spyod do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de 'jig rten pa'i bzod pa sgom par byed cing bcom ldan 'das bdag ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'di lta bu la spyod do //
translated: Blessed One, I am practicing this perfection of patience.

original: bdag ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do snyam nas de des nga rgyal du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do snyam nas de des nga rgyal du 'gyur ro //
translated: I am perfecting the perfection of patience.’ They become proud because of that.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de 'jig rten pa'i brtson 'grus rtsom par byed cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de 'jig rten pa'i brtson 'grus rtsom par byed cing /
translated: That bodhisattva mahāsattva will make an effort at mundane perseverance.

original: bcom ldan 'das bdag ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di lta bu la spyod do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di lta bu la spyod do //
translated: Blessed One, I am practicing the perfection of perseverance!

original: bdag ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do snyam nas de des nga rgyal du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do snyam nas de des nga rgyal du 'gyur ro //
translated: I am perfecting the perfection of perseverance!’ In this way they become conceited.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jug par byed cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jug par byed cing /
translated: “Blessed One, when bodhisattva great beings are practicing the worldly concentrations,

original: bcom ldan 'das bdag ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di lta bu la spyod do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di lta bu la spyod do //
translated: Blessed One, I am practicing the perfection of concentration!

original: bdag ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do snyam nas de des nga rgyal du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do snyam nas de des nga rgyal du 'gyur ro //
translated: I am perfecting the perfection of concentration!’ In this way they become conceited.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de 'jig rten pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing thabs mi mkhas pas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de 'jig rten pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing thabs mi mkhas pas /
translated: “Blessed One, when bodhisattva great beings are practicing the worldly perfection of wisdom, lacking skill in means,

original: bcom ldan 'das bdag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
translated: Blessed One, I am practicing the perfection of wisdom!

original: @53b bdag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do snyam nas de des nga rgyal du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @53b bdag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do snyam nas de des nga rgyal du 'gyur ro //
translated: ’ In this way, they become proud.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de 'jig rten pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa sgom par byed cing 'di snyam du bdag ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa sgom par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de 'jig rten pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa sgom par byed cing 'di snyam du bdag ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa sgom par byed do //
translated: “When bodhisattva great beings cultivate the mundane applications of mindfulness, they think, ‘I am cultivating the applications of mindfulness.🔽I am cultivating the correct exertions,🔽the supports for miraculous ability,🔽the faculties,🔽the powers,🔽the branches of awakening,

original: bdag ni yang dag par spong ba dang / bdag ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / bdag ni dbang po dang / bdag ni stobs dang / bdag ni byang chub kyi yan lag dang / bdag ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa sgom par byed do //
analyzed: bdag ni yang dag par spong ba dang / bdag ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / bdag ni dbang po dang / bdag ni stobs dang / bdag ni byang chub kyi yan lag dang / bdag ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa sgom par byed do //
translated: and the noble eightfold path.🔽I am cultivating the emptiness,

original: bdag ni stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin sgom par byed do //
analyzed: bdag ni stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin sgom par byed do //
translated: signlessness, and wishlessness meditative stabilizations.

original: bdag ni ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / bdag ni gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / bdag ni tshad med pa dang / bdag ni bsam gtan dang / bdag ni gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa sgom par byed do //
analyzed: bdag ni ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / bdag ni gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / bdag ni tshad med pa dang / bdag ni bsam gtan dang / bdag ni gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa sgom par byed do //
translated: I am cultivating the meditative stabilities, I am cultivating the dhāraṇī gateways, I am cultivating the immeasurables, I am cultivating the concentrations, I am cultivating the formless absorptions,

original: bdag ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / bdag ni mngon par shes pa dang / bdag ni stobs bcu dang / bdag ni mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / bdag ni so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / bdag ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad sgom par byed do //
analyzed: bdag ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / bdag ni mngon par shes pa dang / bdag ni stobs bcu dang / bdag ni mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / bdag ni so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / bdag ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad sgom par byed do //
translated: I am cultivating the four noble truths, I am cultivating the clairvoyances, I am cultivating the ten powers, I am cultivating the four fearlessnesses, I am cultivating the four detailed and thorough knowledges, I am cultivating the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,

original: bdag ni sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: bdag ni sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: I am bringing beings to maturity,

original: bdag ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed do //
analyzed: bdag ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed do //
translated: I am purifying a buddhafield,🔽I am attaining the knowledge of all aspects.’

original: bdag ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed do snyam du sems nas bdag dang bdag gir bgyi ba la mngon par chags pa des nga rgyal du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed do snyam du sems nas bdag dang bdag gir bgyi ba la mngon par chags pa des nga rgyal du 'gyur ro //
translated: “He becomes proud because of his attachment to ‘I’ and ‘mine.’

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar 'jig rten pa'i chos rnams la spyod cing /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar 'jig rten pa'i chos rnams la spyod cing /
translated: Blessed One, bodhisattva great beings who practice in this way, with worldly dharmas,

original: bdag dang bdag gir bgyi ba la mngon par chags pas nga rgyal du 'gyur ba de la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dul ba dang nga rgyal ma mchis pa'i slad du nye bar gnas so zhes bya ba ni kun nas dul ba'i byed
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir bgyi ba la mngon par chags pas nga rgyal du 'gyur ba de la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dul ba dang nga rgyal ma mchis pa'i slad du nye bar gnas so zhes bya ba ni kun nas dul ba'i byed
translated: and who are attached to ‘I’ and ‘mine’ and so become proud, for them the perfection of wisdom is present in order to tame them and to eliminate pride.

original: pa'o // bcom ldan 'das 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos la spyad cing sbyin pa gtong ba na sbyin pa yang mi dmigs /
analyzed: pa'o // bcom ldan 'das 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos la spyad cing sbyin pa gtong ba na sbyin pa yang mi dmigs /
translated: “Blessed One, here bodhisattva great beings who practice in this way, with supramundane dharmas, when they give a gift, they do not apprehend the gift,

original: gtong ba yang mi dmigs /
analyzed: gtong ba yang mi dmigs /
translated: they do not apprehend the giver,

original: len pa yang mi dmigs te /
analyzed: len pa yang mi dmigs te /
translated: and they do not apprehend the recipient.

original: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yongs su dul @54a * //

analyzed: tshangs pa mdun na 'don dang / tshangs 'khor dang / 'og min gyi bar gyi lha rnams dang / 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med grangs med pa rnams kyi rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams dang / sum cu rtsa gsum dang / 'thab bral dang /
translated: Brahmapurohita, Brahmapārṣadya, and Akaniṣṭha realms in countless, limitless world systems, together with their retinues, have assembled and are seated.

original: dga' ldan dang / 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed dang / tshangs ris dang / tshangs pa mdun na 'don dang / tshangs 'khor dang / 'og min gyi par gyi lha'i bu gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad kyang rigs kyi bu'am /🔽rigs kyi bu mo gang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bris nas 'chang bar 'gyur /
analyzed: dga' ldan dang / 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed dang / tshangs ris dang / tshangs pa mdun na 'don dang / tshangs 'khor dang / 'og min gyi par gyi lha'i bu gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad kyang rigs kyi bu'am / rigs kyi bu mo gang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di bris nas 'chang bar 'gyur /
translated: and the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three, the Yāma gods, the gods of Tuṣita, the Nirmāṇarati gods, the Para­nirmita­vaśa­vartin gods, the gods of Brahmakāyika, the gods of Brahmapurohita, the gods of Brahmapārṣadya, and the gods of Akaniṣṭha, all of them will come to the place where this deep perfection of wisdom is being written out, recited,🔽and kept.🔽

original: klog par 'gyur ba de dag la bsrung ba dang / bskyab pa dang / sbed par byed de /
analyzed: klog par 'gyur ba de dag la bsrung ba dang / bskyab pa dang / sbed par byed de /
translated: and the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three, the Yāma gods, the gods of Tuṣita, the Nirmāṇarati gods, the Para­nirmita­vaśa­vartin gods, the gods of Brahmakāyika, the gods of Brahmapurohita, the gods of Brahmapārṣadya, and the gods up to the Akaniṣṭha realm, all of them will guard, protect, and keep safe the sons of enlightened heritage or daughters of enlightened heritage who write out, hold, and read this deep perfection of wisdom.

original: de ltar lha'i bu dag 'ongs nas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la rim gror byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: de ltar lha'i bu dag 'ongs nas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la rim gror byed par 'gyur /
translated: The gods will come and honor this deep perfection of wisdom.

original: bla mar byed par 'gyur /🔽bsti stang du byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: bla mar byed par 'gyur / bsti stang du byed par 'gyur /
translated: They will revere it.

original: mchod par byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mchod par byed par 'gyur te /
translated: They will worship it.

original: mchod pa byas shing 'dong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mchod pa byas shing 'dong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having worshipped it, they will leave.

original: gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bris te 'chang bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bris te 'chang bar 'gyur /
translated: Those who write out and hold this perfection of wisdom

original: klog par 'gyur ba de la mthong ba'i chos la phan yon 'di dag 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: klog par 'gyur ba de la mthong ba'i chos la phan yon 'di dag 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: For those who read it, these benefits will arise in this very life.

original: koo shi ka 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: koo shi ka 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Kauśika, it is like this:

original: byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug gam /
analyzed: byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug gam /
translated: whether sitting at the seat of awakening,

original: snying po byang chub kyi nang na @56a * //
analyzed: snying po byang chub kyi nang na @56a * //
translated: or in the inner sanctum of the seat of awakening,

original: 'dug pa'i dud 'gro'i skye gnas su gtogs nas bzung ba gang su dag kyang rung ste /🔽de dag la mi'am mi ma yin pas gtse ba'am /
analyzed: 'dug pa'i dud 'gro'i skye gnas su gtogs nas bzung ba gang su dag kyang rung ste / de dag la mi'am mi ma yin pas gtse ba'am /
translated: any beings who are born as animals

original: tho 'tshams par mi nus so //
analyzed: tho 'tshams par mi nus so //
translated: cannot be harmed or disturbed by humans or non-humans.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang de la bzhugs nas /
analyzed: sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang de la bzhugs nas /
translated: Because the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddhas of the past, having sat there,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas la /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas la /
translated: attained unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: ma byon ba dang / da ltar gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //🔽mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: ma byon ba dang / da ltar gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro // mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: The Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones of the past and future, and also of the present, have attained, will attain, and are attaining complete and perfect awakening.🔽They have attained, will attain, and are attaining complete and perfect awakening.

original: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang /
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang /
translated: And having attained, will attain, and are attaining complete and perfect awakening,

original: sems can thams cad bde ba dang / 'jigs pa med pa dang / 'khon med pa dang / gcugs med pa dang / mi skrag pa dang / rtsod pa med pa dang / 'gran zla med pa la 'god par byed do //
analyzed: sems can thams cad bde ba dang / 'jigs pa med pa dang / 'khon med pa dang / gcugs med pa dang / mi skrag pa dang / rtsod pa med pa dang / 'gran zla med pa la 'god par byed do //
translated: they establish all beings in happiness, in fearlessness, in freedom from enmity, in freedom from hostility, in freedom from anxiety, in freedom from dispute, and in freedom from rivalry.

original: bde ba dang / 'jigs pa med pa dang / 'khon med pa dang / gcugs med pa dang / mi skrag pa dang / rtsod pa med pa dang / 'gran zla med pa la bkod nas kyang sems can tshad med pa grangs med pa thams cad lha dang mi'i phun sum tshogs pa la 'god par byed do //
analyzed: bde ba dang / 'jigs pa med pa dang / 'khon med pa dang / gcugs med pa dang / mi skrag pa dang / rtsod pa med pa dang / 'gran zla med pa la bkod nas kyang sems can tshad med pa grangs med pa thams cad lha dang mi'i phun sum tshogs pa la 'god par byed do //
translated: having established them in happiness, fearlessness, freedom from hostility, freedom from deceit, freedom from anxiety, freedom from dispute, and freedom from rivalry, he establishes all beings, countless and limitless, in the excellence of gods and humans.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub nyid dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la 'god par byed do //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub nyid dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la 'god par byed do //
translated: He establishes them in the fruit of entering the stream, in the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, in the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, in arhatship, in individual enlightenment, and in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid kyis sa'i phyogs de sems can thams cad kyi mchod rten du gyur par byas pas me tog dang / spos dang / dri dang / phreng ba dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / na bza' dang /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid kyis sa'i phyogs de sems can thams cad kyi mchod rten du gyur par byas pas me tog dang / spos dang / dri dang / phreng ba dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / na bza' dang /
translated: And by this very perfection of wisdom, that place of earth will have become a caitya for all beings, and will be worshipped with flowers, incense, perfume, garlands, ointments, aromatic powders, cloths,🔽parasols, flags and banners, and will be honoured, revered, worshipped and adored.

original: gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan mang pos phyag bya ba dang / bla mar bya ba dang / bsti stang du bya ba dang / mchod par bya ba dang / rim gror bya ba dang / bkur stir bya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rten pa'i yul mchod pa byed pa yin te /
analyzed: gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan mang pos phyag bya ba dang / bla mar bya ba dang / bsti stang du bya ba dang / mchod par bya ba dang / rim gror bya ba dang / bkur stir bya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rten pa'i yul mchod pa byed pa yin te /
translated: This is the worship of the object of support.

original: 'di dag gis ni byed pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di dag gis ni byed pa gsungs so //
translated: By these (verses), the action (of the perfection of wisdom) is taught.

original: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das la lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das la lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then, the Lord of the Gods, Sakra, said this to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das @56b rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bris shing glegs bam du chud par bgyid de bcangs la /🔽de la me tog dang / spos dang / dri dang / phreng ba dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / na bza' dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang / khor khor yug tu mar me'i phreng ba dang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das @56b rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bris shing glegs bam du chud par bgyid de bcangs la / de la me tog dang / spos dang / dri dang / phreng ba dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / na bza' dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang / khor khor yug tu mar me'i phreng ba dang /
translated: Blessed One, if some son or daughter of noble family were to write out this perfection of wisdom, make it into a book, and carry it,🔽and if they were to honor, venerate, respect, and make offerings to it with many kinds of offerings—flowers, incense, perfume, garlands, ointments, powders, clothes, parasols, victory banners, and flags, and with rows of lamps all around it—

original: mchod pa rnam pa mang po dag gis rim gro dang / bla ma dang / bsti stang dang / mchod par bgyid pa dang / gang la las de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i sku gdung rnams mchod rten du stsal te stsal nas kyang de la me tog dang /
analyzed: mchod pa rnam pa mang po dag gis rim gro dang / bla ma dang / bsti stang dang / mchod par bgyid pa dang / gang la las de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i sku gdung rnams mchod rten du stsal te stsal nas kyang de la me tog dang /
translated: and if some others were to enshrine the relics of the tathāgatas, the arhats, the perfectly awakened ones who have passed into parinirvāṇa in stūpas, and having done so were to honor them with flowers,

original: spos dang / dri dang / phreng ba dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / na bza' dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan mang pos rim gro dang / bla ma dang / bsti stang dang / mchod pa bgyid na de dag las bsod nams kyi phung po gang mang du 'phel ba lags /
analyzed: spos dang / dri dang / phreng ba dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / na bza' dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan mang pos rim gro dang / bla ma dang / bsti stang dang / mchod pa bgyid na de dag las bsod nams kyi phung po gang mang du 'phel ba lags /
translated: incense, perfume, garlands, ointments, powders, clothes, parasols, victory banners, and flags, and they honor, venerate, and worship them, which of them would generate the greater amount of merit?”

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyi lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin la bka' stsal pa /🔽koo shi ka de bas na khyod nyid la dris /
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyi lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin la bka' stsal pa / koo shi ka de bas na khyod nyid la dris /
translated: When this had been said, the Blessed One said to Śakra, Lord of the Gods:🔽“Kauśika, I will ask you something in return.🔽Give me an answer according to your understanding.”

original: ji ltar bzod pa de bzhin du 'dir lung ston cig / koo shi ka de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: ji ltar bzod pa de bzhin du 'dir lung ston cig / koo shi ka de ji snyam du sems /
translated: “Kauśika, what do you think?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / gang yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i bdag gi dngos po 'di mngon par grub pa de lam gang la bslabs pas de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / gang yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i bdag gi dngos po 'di mngon par grub pa de lam gang la bslabs pas de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs
translated: the knowledge of all aspects of the tathāgatas, the arhats, the perfectly enlightened buddhas, and also this very self-existence of the tathāgatas is manifestly accomplished.

original: par sangs rgyas te bdag gi dngos po 'di lta bu mngon par 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: par sangs rgyas te bdag gi dngos po 'di lta bu mngon par 'grub par 'gyur /
translated: The tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas, having trained in which path, fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, and this very self-existence is manifestly accomplished.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Lord having said that, Śatakratu, head of the gods, said to him,

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la bslabs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la bslabs te /
translated: “Lord, having trained in this very perfection of wisdom,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te bdag gi dngos po 'di mngon par grub po //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te bdag gi dngos po 'di mngon par grub po //
translated: “The Tathāgata, the Arhat, the perfectly enlightened Buddha, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, has accomplished this thing called self.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: koo shi ka @57a * //🔽de de bzhin no //
analyzed: koo shi ka @57a * // de de bzhin no //
translated: “Kauśika,🔽it is so,

original: de de bzhin te /🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la bslabs nas de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te bdag gi dngos po
analyzed: de de bzhin te / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la bslabs nas de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te bdag gi dngos po
translated: it is just so.

original: 'di mngon par grub po //
analyzed: 'di mngon par grub po //
translated: Having trained in this perfection of wisdom, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the perfectly enlightened Buddha has fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening and has accomplished this thing called self.

original: des na koo shi ka bdag gi dngos po 'di thob pas ni de bzhin gshegs pa de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba'i grangs su mi 'gro'i /
analyzed: des na koo shi ka bdag gi dngos po 'di thob pas ni de bzhin gshegs pa de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba'i grangs su mi 'gro'i /
translated: Therefore, Kauśika, because of this accomplishment of this thing called self, the Tathāgata is not counted as a tathāgata.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob pas de bzhin gshegs pa de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob pas de bzhin gshegs pa de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro'o //
translated: Having attained the knowledge of all modes, he becomes a Tathagata, a Saint, perfectly enlightened.

original: koo shi ka rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las byung ngo //
analyzed: koo shi ka rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las byung ngo //
translated: The knowledge of all modes, Kausika, has issued from the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa'i bdag gi dngos po 'di thob pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las byung ba nyid de /
analyzed: de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa'i bdag gi dngos po 'di thob pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las byung ba nyid de /
translated: Thus the attainment of the own-being of the Tathagata has issued from the perfection of wisdom.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi rten du gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi rten du gyur pa yin no //
translated: It is the basis of the knowledge of all modes.

original: de ltar na rten 'di la brten nas thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob pa 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de ltar na rten 'di la brten nas thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob pa 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: Thus, based on this basis, the knowledge of all modes is attained.

original: sangs rgyas 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: The Buddhas appear.

original: chos 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: chos 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: The Dharma appears.

original: dge 'dun 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge 'dun 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The Sangha appears.

original: de ltar bdag gi dngos po 'di thob pa yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes 'di'i rgyu can dang gzhir gyur pas sems can thams cad kyi mchod rten du gyur cing phyag bya ba dang / rim gror bya ba dang / bla mar bya ba dang /
analyzed: de ltar bdag gi dngos po 'di thob pa yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes 'di'i rgyu can dang gzhir gyur pas sems can thams cad kyi mchod rten du gyur cing phyag bya ba dang / rim gror bya ba dang / bla mar bya ba dang /
translated: In the same way, since this attainment of my body is the cause and basis of this knowledge of the knowledge of all aspects, it has become a stūpa for all sentient beings, and it is to be worshipped, to be honored, to be revered,

original: bsti stang du bya ba dang / rjed par bya ba dang / bkur sti bya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bsti stang du bya ba dang / rjed par bya ba dang / bkur sti bya bar 'gyur te /
translated: to be respected, to be made much of, to be praised,

original: nga yongs su mya ngan las 'das par gyur kyang de ltar sku gdung 'di rnams la mchod par 'gyur ro ;🔽/ koo shi ka de bas na rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: nga yongs su mya ngan las 'das par gyur kyang de ltar sku gdung 'di rnams la mchod par 'gyur ro ; / koo shi ka de bas na rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: and even after I have passed into nirvāṇa, these bodily remains will be worshipped in that way.

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang la las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bris nas glegs bam du chud par byas te 'chang bar 'gyur /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang la las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bris nas glegs bam du chud par byas te 'chang bar 'gyur /
translated: Kauśika, therefore, any son of a good family or daughter of a good family who, having written out this perfection of wisdom, makes it into a book and keeps it,

original: klog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: klog par 'gyur te /
translated: and reads it,

original: me tog dang / spos dang / dri dang / phreng ba dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / na bza' dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan rnam pa sna tshogs pa mang pos rim gror byas /
analyzed: me tog dang / spos dang / dri dang / phreng ba dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / na bza' dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan rnam pa sna tshogs pa mang pos rim gror byas /
translated: and with various kinds of flowers, incense, perfume, garlands, ointments, powders, clothes, parasols, flags, and banners,

original: bla mar byas /🔽bsti stang du byas /🔽mchod par byas /
analyzed: bla mar byas / bsti stang du byas / mchod par byas /
translated: honored,🔽revered,

original: rjed par byas /
analyzed: rjed par byas /
translated: worshipped,🔽and made much of,

original: bkur stir byas na 'di nyid de bas ches bsod nams mang du 'phel lo //
analyzed: bkur stir byas na 'di nyid de bas ches bsod nams mang du 'phel lo //

analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum thob pa ni de bas kyang ches nyung ngo //

original: 'jig rten gyi khams gang dang gang na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ba de dag tu sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi drung du padma las rdzus shing skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams gang dang gang na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ba de dag tu sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi drung du padma las rdzus shing skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In whatever world-realms the Blessed Buddhas appear, he will be born miraculously from a lotus in the presence of those Blessed Buddhas.

original: nam yang mngon par shes pa dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ro //🔽de 'dod na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la @71a * //
analyzed: nam yang mngon par shes pa dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ro // de 'dod na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la @71a * //
translated: He will never be separated from the superknowledges.

original: bsnyen bkur bya ba dang / chos mnyan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bsnyen bkur bya ba dang / chos mnyan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro bar 'gyur te /
translated: If he wishes, he will go from buddhafield to buddhafield in order to serve the Blessed Buddhas and to hear the Dharma.

original: de sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro zhing sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: de sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro zhing sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: He will go from buddhafield to buddhafield and will bring beings to maturity.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed do //🔽koo shi ka de bas na rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed do // koo shi ka de bas na rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: they will purify a buddhafield.

original: rigs kyi bu mos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gzung bar bya /🔽bcang bar bya /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gzung bar bya / bcang bar bya /
translated: “Therefore, Kauśika, a son of a good family or a daughter of a good family should take up this perfection of wisdom,🔽carry it,

original: klag par bya /🔽kun chub par bya /
analyzed: klag par bya / kun chub par bya /
translated: read it,🔽master it,

original: tshul bzhin du yid la bya /
analyzed: tshul bzhin du yid la bya /
translated: and properly pay attention to it,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems dang yang ma bral par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems dang yang ma bral par bya'o //
translated: and not be without the thought of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de dag ni nam bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du tshe 'di'i yon tan dang / tshe rabs gzhan gyi yon tan de dag dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag ni nam bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du tshe 'di'i yon tan dang / tshe rabs gzhan gyi yon tan de dag dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: From now until they fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, they will have the good qualities of this life and the good qualities of other lives.”

original: de nas mu stegs can gzhan kun tu rgyu ba brgya tsam zhig klan ka tshol ba'i bsam pas bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der 'ong bar gyur to //
analyzed: de nas mu stegs can gzhan kun tu rgyu ba brgya tsam zhig klan ka tshol ba'i bsam pas bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der 'ong bar gyur to //
translated: Then about a hundred non-Buddhist wanderers came to where the Lord was with the intention of finding fault.

original: de nas lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin 'di snyam du sems par gyur te /🔽mu stegs can gzhan kun tu rgyu ba brgya po 'di dag klan ka tshol ba'i bsam pas bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der 'ongs kyi bdag gis ci nas kyang mu stegs can gzhan kun tu rgyu ba brgya po 'di dag bcom ldan 'das kyi drung du 'ongs
analyzed: de nas lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin 'di snyam du sems par gyur te / mu stegs can gzhan kun tu rgyu ba brgya po 'di dag klan ka tshol ba'i bsam pas bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der 'ongs kyi bdag gis ci nas kyang mu stegs can gzhan kun tu rgyu ba brgya po 'di dag bcom ldan 'das kyi drung du 'ongs
translated: Then Śakra, Lord of the Gods, thought this:🔽“These one hundred non-Buddhist wandering mendicants have come to where the Lord is with the intention of finding fault.

original: nas bar chad byed par mi 'gyur bar bdag gis bcom ldan 'das la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las ji snyed cig gzung ba de dag kha ton du byas te /
analyzed: nas bar chad byed par mi 'gyur bar bdag gis bcom ldan 'das la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las ji snyed cig gzung ba de dag kha ton du byas te /
translated: I will recite to them as much of this perfection of wisdom as I have learned from the Lord, so that these one hundred non-Buddhist wandering mendicants will not be able to come to where the Lord is

original: de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bshad pa la bar chad du mi 'gyur ro zhes bsams so //
analyzed: de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bshad pa la bar chad du mi 'gyur ro zhes bsams so //
translated: and create an obstacle to the explanation of this perfection of wisdom.”

original: de nas lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyis bcom ldan 'das las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ji snyed cig gzung ba de dag kha ton du byas so //
analyzed: de nas lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyis bcom ldan 'das las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ji snyed cig gzung ba de dag kha ton du byas so //
translated: Then Śakra, Lord of the Gods, recited to them as much of this perfection of wisdom as he had learned from the Lord.

original: de nas mu stegs can gzhan kun tu rgyu ba de dag rgyang ring ba bas kyang ches ring ba nas bcom ldan 'das la g-yas phyogs su bskor ba byas te /
analyzed: de nas mu stegs can gzhan kun tu rgyu ba de dag rgyang ring ba bas kyang ches ring ba nas bcom ldan 'das la g-yas phyogs su bskor ba byas te /
translated: Then, those non-Buddhist wanderers circumambulated the Blessed One, keeping him to their right, from a great distance.

original: lam de nyid dang sgo de nyid nas phyir ldog ste dong ngo //
analyzed: lam de nyid dang sgo de nyid nas phyir ldog ste dong ngo //
translated: Then they turned back and left by the same path and gate by which they had come.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Then the venerable Śāriputra thought this:

original: ci'i phyir de ltar mu stegs can gzhan kun tu rgyu ba de dag rgyang ring ba bas kyang ches ring ba nas bcom ldan 'das la g-yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas lam de nyid las phyir log ste dong snyam mo //
analyzed: ci'i phyir de ltar mu stegs can gzhan kun tu rgyu ba de dag rgyang ring ba bas kyang ches ring ba nas bcom ldan 'das la g-yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas lam de nyid las phyir log ste dong snyam mo //
translated: “Why did those non-Buddhist wanderers circumambulate the Blessed One, keeping him to their right, from a great distance, and then turn back and leave by the same path and gate by which they had come?”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a @71b ri'i bu'i sems kyi rtog pa thugs kyis mkhyen nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a @71b ri'i bu'i sems kyi rtog pa thugs kyis mkhyen nas /
translated: Then the Blessed One, knowing in his mind the thoughts in the mind of the venerable Śāriputra,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la bka' stsal pa /
translated: said this to the venerable Śāriputra:🔽“Śāriputra, those non-Buddhist wanderers circumambulated me, keeping me to their right, from a great distance, and then turned back and left by the same path and gate by which they had come, because they will not see me again.

original: sh'a ri'i bu lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par bsams te /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par bsams te /
translated: Śāriputra, Śakra, Lord of the Gods, has contemplated the perfection of wisdom.

original: de'i phyir mu stegs can gzhan kun tu rgyu ba de dag rgyang ring ba bas kyang ches ring ba nas nga la g-yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas lam de nyid dang / sgo de nyid nas phyir log ste dong ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir mu stegs can gzhan kun tu rgyu ba de dag rgyang ring ba bas kyang ches ring ba nas nga la g-yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas lam de nyid dang / sgo de nyid nas phyir log ste dong ngo //
translated: Therefore, those non-Buddhist wanderers circumambulated me clockwise from afar and then left by the same path and door by which they had come.

original: sh'a ri'i bu mu stegs can kun tu rgyu ba 'di rnams las 'ga' tsam yang dkar bo'i sems dang ldan pa ma mthong ste /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu mu stegs can kun tu rgyu ba 'di rnams las 'ga' tsam yang dkar bo'i sems dang ldan pa ma mthong ste /
translated: Śāriputra, I did not see even one of those non-Buddhist wanderers with a virtuous mind.

original: mu stegs can gzhan kun tu rgyu ba de dag thams cad ni gnod par bya ba'i sems dang ldan pa klan ka tshol ba'i bsam pa can sha stag go //
analyzed: mu stegs can gzhan kun tu rgyu ba de dag thams cad ni gnod par bya ba'i sems dang ldan pa klan ka tshol ba'i bsam pa can sha stag go //
translated: All those non-Buddhist wanderers had malicious minds and were intent on finding fault.

original: sh'a ri'i bu 'khor 'dir 'ong bar sems pa 'jig rten lha dang bcas pa dang / bdud dang bcas pa dang / tshangs pa dang bcas pa dang / dge sbyong dang bram zer bcas pa'i skye dgu 'di dag thams cad kyi nang na yang gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid bstan pa'i tshe /🔽zhe sdang ba'i sems sam /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu 'khor 'dir 'ong bar sems pa 'jig rten lha dang bcas pa dang / bdud dang bcas pa dang / tshangs pa dang bcas pa dang / dge sbyong dang bram zer bcas pa'i skye dgu 'di dag thams cad kyi nang na yang gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid bstan pa'i tshe / zhe sdang ba'i sems sam /
translated: Śāriputra, I do not see anyone in this assembly, in this world with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, in this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods, humans, and asuras, who could with their minds, with thoughts of hostility or with thoughts of contention, approach this perfection of wisdom when it is being demonstrated,

original: klan ka tshol ba'i bsam pas nye bar 'ong ba ma mthong ste de dag ni gnas med do //
analyzed: klan ka tshol ba'i bsam pas nye bar 'ong ba ma mthong ste de dag ni gnas med do //
translated: and who could say: This is not the perfection of wisdom, this is not the teaching of the perfection of wisdom, this is not the method of entry into the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sh'a ri'i bu de ni 'di ltar stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di na rgyal chen bzhi'i ris dang / sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams dang / 'thab bral dang / dga' ldan dang / 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed dang /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu de ni 'di ltar stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di na rgyal chen bzhi'i ris dang / sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams dang / 'thab bral dang / dga' ldan dang / 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed dang /
translated: Śāriputra, it is because in this great trichiliocosm, in the Catur­mahā­rāja­kāyika gods, the Trāyastriṃśa gods, the Yāma gods, the Tuṣita gods, the Nirmāṇa­rata gods, and the Para­nirmita­vaśa­vartin gods,

original: tshangs ris dang / tshangs pa mdun na 'don dang / tshangs 'khor dang / 'og min gyi bar gyi lha'i bu gang ji snyed cig yod pa dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig yod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang ji snyed cig yod pa de dag gis kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yongs su gzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshangs ris dang / tshangs pa mdun na 'don dang / tshangs 'khor dang / 'og min gyi bar gyi lha'i bu gang ji snyed cig yod pa dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig yod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang ji snyed cig yod pa de dag gis kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yongs su gzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and the gods of the Śubhakṛtsna realm, and the gods of the Bṛhatphala realm, and the gods of the Avṛha realm, and the gods of the Atapa realm, and the gods of the Sudarśana realm, and the gods of the Sudṛśa realm, and the gods of the Akaniṣṭha realm, and the gods of the Brahmakāyika realm, and the gods of the Brahmapurohita realm, and the gods of the Brahmapārṣadya realm, and the gods of the Akaniṣṭha realm, and all the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas and bodhisattva mahāsattvas have also upheld this perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de dag thams cad ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las byung ba sha stag yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag thams cad ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las byung ba sha stag yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because all of them have come forth from the perfection of wisdom.

original: sh'a ri'i bu gzhan yang shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag dang / phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed las phyogs re re'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu gzhan yang shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag dang / phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed las phyogs re re'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang /
translated: “Moreover, Śāriputra, all the blessed buddhas in the world systems of the eastern direction, numerous as the sands of the Ganges river, and all the blessed buddhas in the world systems of the ten directions, numerous as the sands of the Ganges river, together with their śrāvaka saṅghas,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun dang bcas pa dang / lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin @72a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun dang bcas pa dang / lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin @72a * //
translated: their bodhisattva saṅghas, and all the gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras,

original: dang ; nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po gang ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad kyis kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yongs su bzung ngo //
analyzed: dang ; nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po gang ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad kyis kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yongs su bzung ngo //
translated: garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas, have all taken up this perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de dag thams cad ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las byung ba sha stag yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag thams cad ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las byung ba sha stag yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because all of them have emerged from the perfection of wisdom.”

original: de nas bdud sdig can 'di snyam du sems par gyur te /
analyzed: de nas bdud sdig can 'di snyam du sems par gyur te /
translated: Then Māra the Evil One had this thought:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi 'khor bzhi po 'di dag kyang mngon du gyur /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi 'khor bzhi po 'di dag kyang mngon du gyur /
translated: “The four retinues of the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, are present,

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa'i lha'i bu 'di dag kyang mngon du gyur nas gnas pas 'dir ni gdon mi za bar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung ston par 'gyur gyis /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa'i lha'i bu 'di dag kyang mngon du gyur nas gnas pas 'dir ni gdon mi za bar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung ston par 'gyur gyis /
translated: and the sons of gods who enjoy the desire realm and the form realm are also present and dwelling. Therefore, without a doubt, here the bodhisattva great beings will be given prophecies about unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de la bdag gis bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der phyin la mig gis mi rtsol bar bya'o snyam mo //
analyzed: de la bdag gis bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der phyin la mig gis mi rtsol bar bya'o snyam mo //
translated: I will go to the Lord and not look him in the eye.”

original: de nas bdud sdig can gyi dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi pa mngon par sprul nas bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der 'gro 'dod par gyur to //
analyzed: de nas bdud sdig can gyi dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi pa mngon par sprul nas bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der 'gro 'dod par gyur to //
translated: Then Māra the Evil One, having conjured up an army with four divisions, wanted to go to where the Lord was.

original: de nas lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyis 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de nas lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyis 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Then Śatakratu, head of the gods, had this thought:

original: kye ma bdud sdig to can dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi pa mngon par sprul cing bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der 'gro bar 'dod la /🔽bdud sdig to can gyi dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi ba'i tshul rnam par bkod pa 'di ni rgyal po gzugs can snying po'i dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi pa'i bkod pas kyang de tsam mi phod /
analyzed: kye ma bdud sdig to can dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi pa mngon par sprul cing bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der 'gro bar 'dod la / bdud sdig to can gyi dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi ba'i tshul rnam par bkod pa 'di ni rgyal po gzugs can snying po'i dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi pa'i bkod pas kyang de tsam mi phod /
translated: “Alas, the evil Māra has manifested a fourfold army and is going to where the Blessed One is.🔽The evil Māra’s fourfold army is not even a match for the fourfold army of King Bimbisāra.

original: rgyal po sde rab tu pha ma byed kyi dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi pa'i bkod pas kyang de tsam mi phod /
analyzed: rgyal po sde rab tu pha ma byed kyi dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi pa'i bkod pas kyang de tsam mi phod /
translated: It is not even a match for the fourfold army of King Prasenajit.

original: sh'akya rnams kyi dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi ba'i bkod pas kyang de tsam mi phod /
analyzed: sh'akya rnams kyi dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi ba'i bkod pas kyang de tsam mi phod /
translated: It is not even a match for the fourfold army of the Śākyas.

original: li tstsha b'i rnams kyi dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi'i bkod pas kyang de tsam mi phod de /
analyzed: li tstsha b'i rnams kyi dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi'i bkod pas kyang de tsam mi phod de /
translated: It is not even a match for the fourfold army of the Licchavis.

original: bdud sdig can gyi dbung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi pa gang yin pa 'di ni bdud sdig can gyis mngon par sprul te /
analyzed: bdud sdig can gyi dbung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi pa gang yin pa 'di ni bdud sdig can gyis mngon par sprul te /
translated: The evil Māra has manifested this fourfold army.

original: bdud sdig to can 'di ni yun ring po nas bcom ldan 'das la glags lta zhing glags tshol la sems can rnams la yang 'tshe ba'i bsam pa can yin no //
analyzed: bdud sdig to can 'di ni yun ring po nas bcom ldan 'das la glags lta zhing glags tshol la sems can rnams la yang 'tshe ba'i bsam pa can yin no //
translated: “This evil Māra has been looking for an opportunity to harm the Lord for a long time, and he has a malicious attitude towards sentient beings.

original: bdag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dran pas bsam par bya'o gdon par bya'o snyam mo //
analyzed: bdag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dran pas bsam par bya'o gdon par bya'o snyam mo //
translated: I will remember this perfection of wisdom and recite it.”

original: de nas lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa @72b 'di dran pas yang dag par bsams te gsal bar ston par gyur to //
analyzed: de nas lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa @72b 'di dran pas yang dag par bsams te gsal bar ston par gyur to //
translated: Then Śatakratu, head of the gods, having remembered this perfection of wisdom, recited it and made it clear.

original: lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyis ji lta ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dran pas bsams shing gsal bar brjod pa de lta de ltar bdud sdig to can de dag lam de nyid dang / sgo de nyid nas slar log ste song bar gyur to ;
analyzed: lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyis ji lta ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dran pas bsams shing gsal bar brjod pa de lta de ltar bdud sdig to can de dag lam de nyid dang / sgo de nyid nas slar log ste song bar gyur to ;
translated: Just as Śatakratu, head of the gods, was remembering this perfection of wisdom, reciting it, and making it clear, just then the evil Māra, having gone back by that very path and that very gate,

original: / de nas 'khor de na rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha'i bu dang / 'og min gyi bar gyi lha'i bu ji snyed cig 'khod pa de dag gis lha rdzas kyi me tog mang po mngon par sprul nas mdun gyi nam mkha' la 'khod bzhin du bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der gtor to //
analyzed: / de nas 'khor de na rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha'i bu dang / 'og min gyi bar gyi lha'i bu ji snyed cig 'khod pa de dag gis lha rdzas kyi me tog mang po mngon par sprul nas mdun gyi nam mkha' la 'khod bzhin du bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der gtor to //
translated: Then, the sons of the gods from the Catur­mahā­rāja­kāyika realm up to the Akaniṣṭha realm, however many there were in that assembly, emanated many divine flowers and, while standing in the sky in front, scattered them over the Blessed One.
