original: byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang / nyan thos kyi chos rnams dang / slob pa dang / mi slob pa'i chos rnams ster bar byed pa ma yin /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang / nyan thos kyi chos rnams dang / slob pa dang / mi slob pa'i chos rnams ster bar byed pa ma yin /
translated: He does not give the dharmas of the bodhisattvas, the dharmas of the pratyekabuddhas, the dharmas of the śrāvakas, the dharmas of those in training, or the dharmas of those no longer in training.

original: 'dus ma byas kyi dbyings ster bar byed pa ma yin /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi dbyings ster bar byed pa ma yin /
translated: He does not give the unconditioned realm.

original: nang stong pa nyid nas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar ster bar byed pa ma yin /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid nas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar ster bar byed pa ma yin /
translated: He does not give inner emptiness, up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams ster bar byed pa ma yin /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams ster bar byed pa ma yin /
translated: He does not give the perfections.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang /
translated: He does not give the applications of mindfulness, the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the branches of awakening, the path, or the immeasurables.

original: bsam gtan rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams ster bar byed pa ma yin /
analyzed: bsam gtan rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams ster bar byed pa ma yin /
translated: the meditative stabilities, the formless meditative stabilizations, the powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, and the distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du ster bar du ster bar byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽brgya byin gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du ster bar du ster bar byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro // brgya byin gyis smras pa /
translated: up to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: btsun pa sh'a ri'i bu de de bzhin no //
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a ri'i bu de de bzhin no //
translated: Śatakratu then said, “Venerable Śāriputra, it is so!

original: de de bzhin te /🔽btsun pa sh'a ri'i bu ji skad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams ster bar byed pa ma yin /
analyzed: de de bzhin te / btsun pa sh'a ri'i bu ji skad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams ster bar byed pa ma yin /
translated: It is so!

original: @83a * // rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du ster bar byed pa ma yin no zhes zer ba /
analyzed: @83a * // rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du ster bar byed pa ma yin no zhes zer ba /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, you have said, ‘The perfection of wisdom does not make the dharmas on the side of awakening, up to the knowledge of all aspects, available.’

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gnyis su yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gnyis su yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is not dual and does not exist as a duality.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gnyis su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gnyis su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the perfection of wisdom is not dual.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni gnyis su yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni gnyis su yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Similarly, the perfection of concentration, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality, and the perfection of giving are not dual.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni gnyis su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni gnyis su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the perfection of giving is not dual.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin la legs so zhes bya ba gnang ste /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin la legs so zhes bya ba gnang ste /
translated: Then the Lord approved of Śatakratu, head of the gods:

original: koo shi ka legs so legs so //🔽de de bzhin no //
analyzed: koo shi ka legs so legs so // de de bzhin no //
translated: “Good, good, Kauśika!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: It is so, Kauśika, it is so!

original: ji skad smras pa de bzhin no //🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gnyis su yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ji skad smras pa de bzhin no // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gnyis su yod pa ma yin te /
translated: It is just as you say.🔽The perfection of wisdom is not dual.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gnyis su med pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gnyis su med pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is not dual.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni gnyis su yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni gnyis su yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Similarly, the perfection of meditative stability, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of moral discipline, and the perfection of generosity are not dual and are not non-dual.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni gnyis su med pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni gnyis su med pa'o //
translated: The perfection of generosity is not dual and is not non-dual.

original: koo shi ka gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnyis su 'dod pa de ni chos kyi dbyings la gnyis su 'dod du zad do //
analyzed: koo shi ka gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnyis su 'dod pa de ni chos kyi dbyings la gnyis su 'dod du zad do //
translated: Kauśika, whoever asserts that the perfection of wisdom is dual, they are simply asserting that the dharma-constituent is dual.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: koo shi ka de ni 'di ltar chos kyi dbyings dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: koo shi ka de ni 'di ltar chos kyi dbyings dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Kauśika, it is because the dharma-constituent and the perfection of wisdom are not dual and cannot be made dual.

original: de bzhin du chos kyi dbyings dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa de la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du chos kyi dbyings dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa de la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Similarly, the expanse of reality, the perfection of meditative stability, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of moral discipline, and the perfection of generosity are not two, nor are they divided.

original: koo shi ka shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnyis su 'dod pa de ni de bzhin nyid la gnyis su 'dod du zad de /
analyzed: koo shi ka shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnyis su 'dod pa de ni de bzhin nyid la gnyis su 'dod du zad de /
translated: Kauśika, one who asserts that the perfection of wisdom is dual asserts that suchness is dual.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why,

original: koo shi ka de ni 'di ltar de bzhin nyid dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: koo shi ka de ni 'di ltar de bzhin nyid dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Kauśika, it is because suchness and the perfection of wisdom are not two, nor are they divided.

original: de bzhin du de bzhin nyid dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod @83b pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin nyid dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod @83b pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Similarly, this is not a duality, i.e., that the perfection of meditative stabilization and suchness are one thing, and that the perfection of perseverance, perfection of patience, perfection of morality, and perfection of giving are another;

original: koo shi ka shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la gnyis su 'dod pa de ni yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings la gnyis su 'dod du zad do //
analyzed: koo shi ka shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la gnyis su 'dod pa de ni yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings la gnyis su 'dod du zad do //
translated: Kauśika, one who wants to make a duality in this perfection of wisdom makes a duality in the limit of reality and the inconceivable element.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: koo shi ka de ni 'di ltar yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: koo shi ka de ni 'di ltar yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Kauśika, it is because the limit of reality, the inconceivable element, and the perfection of wisdom are not a duality, nor are they separate.

original: de bzhin du yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: Similarly, the limit of reality, the inconceivable expanse, the perfection of meditative stability, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of ethical discipline,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and the perfection of generosity are non-dual and not divided into two.

original: brgya byin gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: brgya byin gyis gsol pa /
translated: Śatakratu then said,

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: “Blessed One, I pay homage to the perfection of wisdom!

original: 'di ni lha dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis phyag bgyi bar 'os pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni lha dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis phyag bgyi bar 'os pa ste /
translated: This is worthy of homage from the world with its gods, humans, and asuras,

original: gang la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis bslabs pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: gang la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis bslabs pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: because the bodhisattva great beings, having trained in it, have fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

original: bcom ldan 'das gang gi tshe bdag chos bzangs lta'i 'dun sa na lha rnams kyi dbang po'i stan la mchis par gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang gi tshe bdag chos bzangs lta'i 'dun sa na lha rnams kyi dbang po'i stan la mchis par gyur pa de'i tshe /
translated: Blessed One, when I am seated on the throne of the lord of gods in the assembly hall of the Thirty-Three,

original: der lha'i bu gang ji snyed cig bdag gi rim gro la mchis pa de dag kun kyang bdag la mchod par bgyid de /
analyzed: der lha'i bu gang ji snyed cig bdag gi rim gro la mchis pa de dag kun kyang bdag la mchod par bgyid de /
translated: all the gods who are present there to serve me worship me.

original: nam bdag seng ge'i khri la mchis par gyur pa de'i tshe yang lha'i bu de dag gnas der mchis shing lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin chos kyi stan 'di la 'dug cing sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha rnams la chos ston to zhes lha'i bu de dag
analyzed: nam bdag seng ge'i khri la mchis par gyur pa de'i tshe yang lha'i bu de dag gnas der mchis shing lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin chos kyi stan 'di la 'dug cing sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha rnams la chos ston to zhes lha'i bu de dag
translated: When I am seated on the lion throne, those gods also remain there, thinking, ‘Śakra, lord of the gods, is seated on this Dharma throne and teaches the Dharma to the gods of the Thirty-Three.’

original: bdag gi stan de la phyag 'tshal te slar mchi'o //
analyzed: bdag gi stan de la phyag 'tshal te slar mchi'o //
translated: They bow down to my throne and then leave.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin du gang na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bris shing gzhag pa'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin du gang na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bris shing gzhag pa'am /
translated: Blessed One, in the same way, wherever this perfection of wisdom is written down and kept,

original: kha ton du bgyid pa'am /
analyzed: kha ton du bgyid pa'am /
translated: or recited,

original: gzhan la rgya cher ston pa de phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi lha'i bu ji snyed cig mchis pa dang / lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang /🔽lto 'phye chen po ji snyed cig mchis pa de dag kyang de bzhin @84a * //
analyzed: gzhan la rgya cher ston pa de phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi lha'i bu ji snyed cig mchis pa dang / lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po ji snyed cig mchis pa de dag kyang de bzhin @84a * //
translated: And those sons of gods in the world systems of the ten directions, and those gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras,

original: gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams ni 'di las byung ngo //
analyzed: gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams ni 'di las byung ngo //
translated: mahoragas, and humans who teach this perfection of wisdom extensively to others, they will know: ‘The tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas have come from this.🔽All the necessities for the happiness of all sentient beings have come from this.’

original: sems can thams cad kyi bad ba'i yo byad thams cad kyang 'di las byung ngo zhes shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la phyag bgyis nas slar mchi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi bad ba'i yo byad thams cad kyang 'di las byung ngo zhes shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la phyag bgyis nas slar mchi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will pay homage to the perfection of wisdom and then leave.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung ji snyed pa de snyed kyis mchod pa brnyes pa yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas bsgrubs pa'i slad du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung ji snyed pa de snyed kyis mchod pa brnyes pa yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas bsgrubs pa'i slad du'o //
translated: The relics of the tathāgatas will receive worship because they are accomplished by the perfection of wisdom.”🔽“Subhūti, it is so! It is so!

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Blessed One, when the bodhisattvas practice bodhisattva activity,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi gzhir gyur to //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi gzhir gyur to //
translated: the perfection of wisdom is the basis of the wisdom of omniscience.

original: rkyen du gyur to //
analyzed: rkyen du gyur to //
translated: It is the condition.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bas na cha de gnyis las bdag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid len to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bas na cha de gnyis las bdag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid len to //
translated: Blessed One, therefore, of these two parts, I would choose just this perfection of wisdom.

original: bcom ldan 'das gang gi tshe bdag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di blangs te /🔽chos nyid kyi khongs su gtogs pa'i yid kyis kha ton bgyid cing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yid la bgyid pa de'i tshe 'jigs pa'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang gi tshe bdag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di blangs te / chos nyid kyi khongs su gtogs pa'i yid kyis kha ton bgyid cing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yid la bgyid pa de'i tshe 'jigs pa'am /
translated: Blessed One, when I have taken up this perfection of wisdom,🔽and recite it mentally, including it within reality, and keep the perfection of wisdom in mind, at that time I do not see even the mere signs of fear or

original: bag tsha ba'i mtshan ma tsam yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: bag tsha ba'i mtshan ma tsam yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: anxiety.

original: bcom ldan 'das de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Blessed One, why is that?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni mtshan ma mchis /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni mtshan ma mchis /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is signless,

original: rtags ma mchis /
analyzed: rtags ma mchis /
translated: without marks,

original: brjod du ma mchis pa ste /
analyzed: brjod du ma mchis pa ste /
translated: and inexpressible.

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni smos su ma mchis pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni smos su ma mchis pa'o //
translated: “Lord, the perfection of wisdom is not mentioned.

original: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni mtshan ma ma mchis /
analyzed: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni mtshan ma ma mchis /
translated: Similarly, Lord, the perfection of concentration, perfection of perseverance, perfection of patience, perfection of morality, and perfection of giving are not mentioned.

original: rtags ma mchis /
analyzed: rtags ma mchis /
translated: They have no causal signs.

original: brjod du ma mchis pa ste /
analyzed: brjod du ma mchis pa ste /
translated: They are inexpressible.

original: bcom ldan 'das sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar ni smos su ma mchis pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar ni smos su ma mchis pa'o //
translated: Lord, the perfection of giving and the knowledge of all aspects are not mentioned.

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni mtshan ma dang bcas pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni mtshan ma dang bcas pa /
translated: “Lord, if the perfection of wisdom were with causal signs,

original: rtags dang bcas pa /🔽brjod pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: rtags dang bcas pa / brjod pa dang bcas pa /
translated: with signs,🔽with expressions,

original: smos pa dang bcas pa zhig lags kyi /🔽mtshan ma ma mchis /🔽rtags ma mchis /
analyzed: smos pa dang bcas pa zhig lags kyi / mtshan ma ma mchis / rtags ma mchis /
translated: and with mention,🔽it would not be the perfection of wisdom.🔽It has no causal signs.🔽It is inexpressible.

translated: And why is that?

analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bris shing 'dzin par bgyid /
translated: Because, Śāriputra, a son of a good family or a daughter of a good family who has written out this perfection of wisdom and who has taken it up,

original: 'chang bar bgyid /🔽klog par bgyid /
analyzed: 'chang bar bgyid / klog par bgyid /
translated: who has borne it in mind,🔽who has recited it,🔽who has mastered it,

original: kun chub par bgyid /
analyzed: kun chub par bgyid /
translated: who has respectfully believed in it,🔽and who has taught it extensively to others will stand on the irreversible level.

original: tshul bzhin du yid la bgyid cing bris pa de la yang me tog dang / spos dang / dri dang / phreng ba dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / na bza' dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan rnams kyis rim gror bgyid /
analyzed: tshul bzhin du yid la bgyid cing bris pa de la yang me tog dang / spos dang / dri dang / phreng ba dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / na bza' dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan rnams kyis rim gror bgyid /
translated: and those who write it out and practice it properly, we will honor,

original: bla mar bgyid /🔽bsti stang du bgyid /
analyzed: bla mar bgyid / bsti stang du bgyid /
translated: revere,

original: mchod par bgyid pa ste /
analyzed: mchod par bgyid pa ste /
translated: and make offerings to them with flowers,🔽incense, perfume, garlands, ointments, powders, clothing, parasols, banners, and flags.

original: de la gang nas kyang 'jigs pa 'byung ba'i dogs pa ma mchis par bgyi'o //
analyzed: de la gang nas kyang 'jigs pa 'byung ba'i dogs pa ma mchis par bgyi'o //
translated: We will not fear anything that might happen to them.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Blessed One, it is like this:

original: skyes bu nor gyi bdag po zhig 'jigs nas rgyal po la brten pas de gang la 'jigs par 'gyur pa de dag nyid kyang de nyid la brten pas de dag gis 'jigs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes bu nor gyi bdag po zhig 'jigs nas rgyal po la brten pas de gang la 'jigs par 'gyur pa de dag nyid kyang de nyid la brten pas de dag gis 'jigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, a wealthy man who is afraid of something will go to the king for protection. He will not fear those who are the source of his fear, because he has gone to the king for protection.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das de ni 'di ltar mthu dang ldan pa la brten nas 'jigs pa ma mchis par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ni 'di ltar mthu dang ldan pa la brten nas 'jigs pa ma mchis par 'gyur ro //
translated: Blessed One, it is because he has gone to someone powerful for protection and is therefore fearless.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin du da bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su bsgrubs pas na mchod pa brnyes so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin du da bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su bsgrubs pas na mchod pa brnyes so //
translated: In the same way, Blessed One, the relics of the Tathāgata are worshipped because they are consecrated by the perfection of wisdom.

original: bcom ldan 'das de la rgyal po ji lta ba bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de lta bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de la rgyal po ji lta ba bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de lta bar bgyi'o //
translated: Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom should be regarded as like the king.

original: rgyal po la brten pa'i skyes bu ji lta ba bzhin du mchod pa brnyes pa de lta bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: rgyal po la brten pa'i skyes bu ji lta ba bzhin du mchod pa brnyes pa de lta bar bgyi'o //
translated: The worship that the relics receive should be regarded as like the worship that the king’s subjects receive.

original: de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su bsgrubs pas mchod pa brnyes so //
analyzed: de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su bsgrubs pas mchod pa brnyes so //
translated: In this way, the relics of the Tathāgata are worshipped because they are consecrated by the perfection of wisdom.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes gang lags @86b pa de yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su bsgrub par blta'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes gang lags @86b pa de yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su bsgrub par blta'o //
translated: Blessed One, the knowledge of all aspects should be regarded as consecrated by the perfection of wisdom.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bas na cha de gnyis las 'dam du stsal na bdag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid len to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bas na cha de gnyis las 'dam du stsal na bdag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid len to //
translated: Therefore, Blessed One, if I had to choose between those two alternatives, I would choose this perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: 'di las byung ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung rnams lags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di las byung ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung rnams lags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the relics of the Tathagata are produced from it.

original: 'di las byung ba ni mi chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis lags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di las byung ba ni mi chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis lags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the thirty-two marks of a superman are produced from it.

original: 'di las byung ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad lags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di las byung ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad lags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the ten powers of a Tathagata, the four grounds of self-confidence, the four analytical knowledges, and the eighteen special Buddhadharmas are produced from it.

original: 'di las byung ba ni byams pa chen po dang snying rje chen po lags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di las byung ba ni byams pa chen po dang snying rje chen po lags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because great love and great compassion are produced from it.

original: 'di las byung ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa lngas pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming thob pa lags ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di las byung ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa lngas pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming thob pa lags ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the five perfections receive the name 'perfection' because they are produced from it.

original: 'di las byung ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid lags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di las byung ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid lags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the knowledge of all modes of the Tathagata has come from this perfection of wisdom.

original: bcom ldan 'das stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams gang na sems can rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dzin par 'gyur /🔽'chang bar 'gyur /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams gang na sems can rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dzin par 'gyur / 'chang bar 'gyur /
translated: In those world systems, Blessed One, where beings will take up this perfection of wisdom, bear it in mind,

original: klog par 'gyur /🔽kun chub par bgyid par 'gyur /
analyzed: klog par 'gyur / kun chub par bgyid par 'gyur /
translated: read it aloud, master it,

original: tshul bzhin du yid la bgyid par 'gyur ba der sems can de rnams la mi'am mi ma lags pas glags lta zhing glags tshol ba rnams kyis glags rnyed par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshul bzhin du yid la bgyid par 'gyur ba der sems can de rnams la mi'am mi ma lags pas glags lta zhing glags tshol ba rnams kyis glags rnyed par mi 'gyur te /
translated: and attend to it in the right way, there beings will not be troubled by any human or nonhuman being who may seek an opportunity to harm them.

original: sems can de dag thams cad mthar gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can de dag thams cad mthar gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can du 'gyur ro //
translated: All those beings will finally come to be possessed of the Dharma of complete Nirvana.

original: bcom ldan 'das de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni don chen po dang ldan pa lags so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni don chen po dang ldan pa lags so //
translated: Blessed One, this perfection of wisdom is endowed with great benefits.

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams gang na sems can ji snyed cig mchis pa de rnams sangs rgyas kyi bya bas nye bar gnas pa lags so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams gang na sems can ji snyed cig mchis pa de rnams sangs rgyas kyi bya bas nye bar gnas pa lags so //
translated: Blessed One, this perfection of wisdom is present with the deeds of a Buddha wherever there are beings in the great billion-fold world systems.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten gyi khams gang na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dar bar 'gyur ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams der ni sangs rgyas 'byung ba dang 'dra bar blta'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten gyi khams gang na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dar bar 'gyur ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams der ni sangs rgyas 'byung ba dang 'dra bar blta'o //
translated: Blessed One, in whatever world system this perfection of wisdom is practiced, one should see that world system as like the emergence of a Buddha.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Blessed One, it is as follows:

original: nor bu rin po che rin thang ma mchis pa zhig mchis par gyur la /
analyzed: nor bu rin po che rin thang ma mchis pa zhig mchis par gyur la /
translated: There is a priceless jewel.

original: nor bu rin po che chen po de la yon tan gyi rnam pa 'di lta bu dag ldan te /
analyzed: nor bu rin po che chen po de la yon tan gyi rnam pa 'di lta bu dag ldan te /
translated: That great jewel has the following qualities:

original: gang dang gang du nor bu rin po che chen po de gzhag pa dang der mi ma lags pa @87a * //
analyzed: gang dang gang du nor bu rin po che chen po de gzhag pa dang der mi ma lags pa @87a * //
translated: Wherever that great jewel is placed, non-humans

original: rnams kyis glags mi rnyed do //
analyzed: rnams kyis glags mi rnyed do //
translated: will not find an opportunity there.

original: skyes pa'am / bud med gang dang gang mi ma lags pas zin par 'gyur ba de dang de la nor bu rin po che chen po de bstan na /
analyzed: skyes pa'am / bud med gang dang gang mi ma lags pas zin par 'gyur ba de dang de la nor bu rin po che chen po de bstan na /
translated: If any man or woman is possessed by any non-human being, if that great precious jewel is shown to them,

original: nor bu rin po che chen po de bstan pa tsam kho nas mi ma lags pa de nor bu rin po che chen po de'i gzi brjid mi bzod pas de myur du mchi'o //
analyzed: nor bu rin po che chen po de bstan pa tsam kho nas mi ma lags pa de nor bu rin po che chen po de'i gzi brjid mi bzod pas de myur du mchi'o //
translated: by merely showing that great precious jewel, that non-human being will not be able to bear the splendor of that great precious jewel and will quickly depart.

original: gang gi tshe mkhris pas gdungs pa'i lus la nor bu rin po che chen po de btags na mkhris pa de yang 'byung bar 'gyur la 'phel bar mi 'gyur te nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ro //🔽rlung gis gdungs pa'i lus la nor bu rin po che chen po de btags na rlung de yang 'byang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe mkhris pas gdungs pa'i lus la nor bu rin po che chen po de btags na mkhris pa de yang 'byung bar 'gyur la 'phel bar mi 'gyur te nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ro // rlung gis gdungs pa'i lus la nor bu rin po che chen po de btags na rlung de yang 'byang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that great precious jewel is applied to a body afflicted by bile, that bile will be eliminated and will not increase, but will be pacified.🔽If that great precious jewel is applied to a body afflicted by wind, that wind will be eliminated.

original: bad kan gyis gdungs pa'i lus la nor bu rin po che chen po de btags na bad kan de rnams thams cad kyang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bad kan gyis gdungs pa'i lus la nor bu rin po che chen po de btags na bad kan de rnams thams cad kyang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that great precious jewel is applied to a body afflicted by phlegm, all that phlegm will be eliminated.

original: 'dus pa'i nad kyis btab pa'i lus la nor bu rin po che chen po de btags na 'dus pa'i nad de zhi bar 'gyur gyi rnam par mi 'phel lo //
analyzed: 'dus pa'i nad kyis btab pa'i lus la nor bu rin po che chen po de btags na 'dus pa'i nad de zhi bar 'gyur gyi rnam par mi 'phel lo //
translated: If it is tied to the body of someone afflicted with a contagious disease, that contagious disease will be pacified and will not spread.

original: nub mo ni nor bu rin po che chen po des snang bar bgyid do //🔽tsha ba'i dus na ni nor bu rin po chen po des phyogs gang du gzhag pa'i sa phyogs de bsil bar bgyid par 'gyur par bgyid do //
analyzed: nub mo ni nor bu rin po che chen po des snang bar bgyid do // tsha ba'i dus na ni nor bu rin po chen po des phyogs gang du gzhag pa'i sa phyogs de bsil bar bgyid par 'gyur par bgyid do //
translated: At night, that great precious jewel will illuminate.🔽In hot weather, the place where that great precious jewel is placed will be cooled.

original: grang ba'i dus na ni nor bu rin po che chen po des phyogs gang du gzhag pa'i sa phyogs de dro bar bgyid par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: grang ba'i dus na ni nor bu rin po che chen po des phyogs gang du gzhag pa'i sa phyogs de dro bar bgyid par 'gyur ro //
translated: In cold weather, the place where that great precious jewel is placed will be warmed.

original: nor bu rin po che chen po de gang du gzhag pa'i sa phyogs de ha cang yang mi dro ha cang yang mi grang zhing dus bde bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nor bu rin po che chen po de gang du gzhag pa'i sa phyogs de ha cang yang mi dro ha cang yang mi grang zhing dus bde bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The place where that great precious jewel is placed will not be too hot, not too cold, and will be pleasant.

original: nor bu rin po che chen po de dogs sa'i phyogs gang du gzhag pa'i sa phyogs der sbrul lam /
analyzed: nor bu rin po che chen po de dogs sa'i phyogs gang du gzhag pa'i sa phyogs der sbrul lam /
translated: In the place where that great precious jewel is placed, there will be no snakes,

original: sdig pa la sogs pa'am gdug pa can rgyu bar mi 'gyur ro /🔽// / bam po sum cu gsum pa /
analyzed: sdig pa la sogs pa'am gdug pa can rgyu bar mi 'gyur ro / // / bam po sum cu gsum pa /
translated: and the evil ones will not be able to move about.

original: skyes pa'am bud med la la zhig sbrul gdug pas zin par gyur pa la nor bu rin po che chen po bstan na de des mthong ma thag tu yang dug de yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes pa'am bud med la la zhig sbrul gdug pas zin par gyur pa la nor bu rin po che chen po bstan na de des mthong ma thag tu yang dug de yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If a man or a woman is bitten by a poisonous snake, if they see this great precious gem, then the moment they see it, the poison will be completely removed.

original: bcom ldan 'das nor bu rin po che chen po de ni yon tan gyi rnam pa de lta bu dag dang ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das nor bu rin po che chen po de ni yon tan gyi rnam pa de lta bu dag dang ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: Bhagavān, this great precious gem has such qualities.

original: skyes pa'am bud med la la zhig nad sna tshogs kyis btab par gyur pa las /
analyzed: skyes pa'am bud med la la zhig nad sna tshogs kyis btab par gyur pa las /
translated: If a man or a woman is afflicted by various illnesses,

original: de rnams kyi lus la nor bu rin po che chen po de btags na de dag gi nad de thams cad kyang zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyi lus la nor bu rin po che chen po de btags na de dag gi nad de thams cad kyang zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: if this great precious gem is attached to their bodies, all their illnesses will be cured.

original: bcom ldan 'das nor bu rin po che chen po de gang gi tshe chab kyi nang du stsal na de'i tshe chab de thams cad kyang gser gyi kha dog dang 'dra bar @87b bgyid do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das nor bu rin po che chen po de gang gi tshe chab kyi nang du stsal na de'i tshe chab de thams cad kyang gser gyi kha dog dang 'dra bar @87b bgyid do //
translated: Blessed One, when that great precious jewel is placed in water, the water becomes the same color as gold.

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te nor bu rin po che chen po de ras sngon pos dkris te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te nor bu rin po che chen po de ras sngon pos dkris te /
translated: Blessed One, if that great precious jewel is wrapped in a blue cloth

original: chab kyi nang du stsal na chab de yang sngon por bgyid do //
analyzed: chab kyi nang du stsal na chab de yang sngon por bgyid do //
translated: and placed in water, the water becomes blue.

original: gal te nor bu rin po che chen po de ras ser po'am /
analyzed: gal te nor bu rin po che chen po de ras ser po'am /
translated: If that great precious jewel is wrapped in a yellow cloth,

original: dmar po'am / le brgan nam /
analyzed: dmar po'am / le brgan nam /
translated: or a red cloth, or a crimson cloth,

original: shel gyi kha dog gi ras kyis dkris te chab kyi nang du stsal na chab de yang de'i kha dog tu bgyid do //
analyzed: shel gyi kha dog gi ras kyis dkris te chab kyi nang du stsal na chab de yang de'i kha dog tu bgyid do //
translated: or a crystal-colored cloth and placed in water, the water becomes that color.

original: chon kha dog sna tshogs kyi ras kyis nor bu rin po che chen po de dkris te chab kyi nang du stsal na chab de yang kha dog sna tshogs su bgyid do //
analyzed: chon kha dog sna tshogs kyi ras kyis nor bu rin po che chen po de dkris te chab kyi nang du stsal na chab de yang kha dog sna tshogs su bgyid do //
translated: If that great precious jewel is wrapped in a cloth of various colors and placed in water, the water becomes multicolored.

original: bcom ldan 'das nor bu rin po che chen po de chab rnyog pa can gyi nang du stsal na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das nor bu rin po che chen po de chab rnyog pa can gyi nang du stsal na /
translated: Blessed One, if that great precious gem is placed in muddy water,

original: chab de thams cad shin tu dang bar bgyid de /
analyzed: chab de thams cad shin tu dang bar bgyid de /
translated: that water will become completely clear.

original: nor bu rin po che chen po de yon tan gyi rnam pa 'di lta bu dag dang ldan par 'gyur ro //🔽de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' pos lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: nor bu rin po che chen po de yon tan gyi rnam pa 'di lta bu dag dang ldan par 'gyur ro // de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' pos lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: That great precious gem will have these kinds of qualities.

original: koo shi ka de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: koo shi ka de ji snyam du sems /
translated: Then the venerable Ānanda said to Śatakratu, head of the gods, “Kauśika, what do you think?

original: nor bu rin po che chen po de lha rdzas zhig yin nam /
analyzed: nor bu rin po che chen po de lha rdzas zhig yin nam /
translated: Is that great precious gem divine,

original: 'on te nor bu rin po che chen po de 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi rnams la yang yod /🔽brgya byin gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'on te nor bu rin po che chen po de 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi rnams la yang yod / brgya byin gyis smras pa /
translated: or do the humans of Jambudvīpa also have that great precious gem?”

original: btsun pa kun dga' bo nor bu rin po che chen po de ni lha rdzas so //
analyzed: btsun pa kun dga' bo nor bu rin po che chen po de ni lha rdzas so //
translated: Śatakratu replied, “Venerable Ānanda, that great precious gem is divine.

original: 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi rnams la nor bu rin po che chen po gang yod pa de ni chung zhing lci la lha rdzas kyi nor bu rin po che chen po gang yin pa de dag ni che zhing yang la /
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi rnams la nor bu rin po che chen po gang yod pa de ni chung zhing lci la lha rdzas kyi nor bu rin po che chen po gang yin pa de dag ni che zhing yang la /
translated: Whatever great precious jewels there are among the people of Jambudvīpa are small and heavy, while whatever great precious jewels there are among the gods are large and light.

original: 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi de rnams kyi nor bu rin po che ni de ltar yon tan gyi rnam pa yongs su rdzogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi de rnams kyi nor bu rin po che ni de ltar yon tan gyi rnam pa yongs su rdzogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The precious jewels of the people of Jambudvīpa are not like that, with all the aspects of good qualities complete.🔽Those precious jewels of Jambudvīpa do not approach even a fraction of that divine precious jewel.

original: 'dzam bu'i gling gi nor bu rin po che de dag gis ni lha rdzas kyi nor bu rin po che de'i grangs su yang nye bar mi 'gro /
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling gi nor bu rin po che de dag gis ni lha rdzas kyi nor bu rin po che de'i grangs su yang nye bar mi 'gro /
translated: They do not approach even a calculation,

original: cha'am / bgrang ba'am /
analyzed: cha'am / bgrang ba'am /
translated: a reckoning,

original: dpe'am / rgyur yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //🔽nor bu rin po che chen po de yang snod la la zhig gi nang du bcug pa las /
analyzed: dpe'am / rgyur yang nye bar mi 'gro'o // nor bu rin po che chen po de yang snod la la zhig gi nang du bcug pa las /
translated: an example, or a cause.🔽That great precious jewel is placed in a vessel,

original: gang gi tshe snod de nas nor bu rin po che chen po de phyung bar gyur kyang /
analyzed: gang gi tshe snod de nas nor bu rin po che chen po de phyung bar gyur kyang /
translated: and when that great precious jewel is taken out of that vessel,

original: de'i tshe 'dir ni nor bu rin po che chen po de gnas par gyur pa'o zhes snod de la dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'dir ni nor bu rin po che chen po de gnas par gyur pa'o zhes snod de la dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, he would be delighted with that vessel, thinking, ‘This is where that great precious gem is located.’

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gang du dang bar 'gyur ba'i sa phyogs der rigs kyi bu'am /🔽rigs kyi bu mo de dag gi lus sam /🔽sems kyi sdug bsngal dang / gnod pa mi las gyur pa'am /

original: de bas na rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: de bas na rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Therefore, Kauśika, the sons of a good family or daughters of a good family

original: rigs kyi bu mo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas chos nyid du sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa bsgom par bgyi'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas chos nyid du sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa bsgom par bgyi'o //
translated: “Noble sons and daughters who practice the perfection of wisdom should cultivate the recollection of the Buddha in terms of the intrinsic nature.

original: bcom ldan 'das gnyis po 'di dag ni chos nyid de /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gnyis po 'di dag ni chos nyid de /
translated: Blessed One, these two are the intrinsic nature:

original: chos nyid gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: chos nyid gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two intrinsic natures?

original: 'dus byas kyi chos nyid dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos nyid do //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos nyid dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos nyid do //
translated: The intrinsic nature of conditioned phenomena and the intrinsic nature of unconditioned phenomena.

original: bcom ldan 'das de la 'dus byas kyi chos nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de la 'dus byas kyi chos nyid gang zhe na /
translated: Blessed One, what is the intrinsic nature of conditioned phenomena?

original: 'di lta ste nang stong pa nyid kyi ye shes dang / phyi stong pa nyid kyi ye shes dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid kyi ye shes dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi ye shes dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gang yin pa rnams dang /
analyzed: 'di lta ste nang stong pa nyid kyi ye shes dang / phyi stong pa nyid kyi ye shes dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid kyi ye shes dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi ye shes dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gang yin pa rnams dang /
translated: It is the wisdom of inner emptiness, the wisdom of outer emptiness, the wisdom of outer and inner emptiness, and the wisdom of the other aspects of emptiness, up to the emptiness that is the essential nature of non-existence, as well as the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa gang yin pa rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa gang yin pa rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu'i ye shes dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa gang yin pa rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa gang yin pa rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu'i ye shes dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang /
translated: The noble truths, the immeasurables, the dhyānas, the formless absorptions, the wisdom of the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses,

original: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi ye shes dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi ye shes dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang /
translated: the four detailed and thorough knowledges, the wisdom of the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, the roots of virtue and nonvirtue, the contaminated and uncontaminated,

original: kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams kyi ye shes gang lags pa de ni 'dus byas kyi chos nyid ces bgyi'o //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams kyi ye shes gang lags pa de ni 'dus byas kyi chos nyid ces bgyi'o //
translated: the reprehensible and irreproachable, the mundane and supramundane, and the afflicted and purified phenomena—that wisdom is called the nature of conditioned phenomena.

original: de la 'dus ma byas kyi chos nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'dus ma byas kyi chos nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the unconditioned nature of phenomena?

original: de ni gang la skye ba ma mchis pa dang / @90a * //
analyzed: de ni gang la skye ba ma mchis pa dang / @90a * //
translated: It is that which is unborn,🔽undying,🔽unabiding,🔽non-abiding,🔽uncorrupted,🔽unpurified,🔽non-increasing,

original: 'gag pa ma mchis pa dang / gnas pa ma mchis pa dang / mi gnas pa ma mchis pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa ma mchis pa dang / rnam par byang ba ma mchis pa dang / 'phel ba ma mchis pa dang / 'grib pa ma mchis pa dang /
analyzed: 'gag pa ma mchis pa dang / gnas pa ma mchis pa dang / mi gnas pa ma mchis pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa ma mchis pa dang / rnam par byang ba ma mchis pa dang / 'phel ba ma mchis pa dang / 'grib pa ma mchis pa dang /
translated: non-decreasing,

original: chos thams cad kyi dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid la brjod par bgyi'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid la brjod par bgyi'o //
translated: and is to be expressed as the nature of the non-existence of all phenomena.

original: chos thams cad kyi dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid gang lags she na /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid gang lags she na /
translated: What is the nature of the non-existence of all phenomena?

original: gang nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid stong pa nyid dang / chen po stong pa nyid dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid dang / 'dus byas stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: gang nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid stong pa nyid dang / chen po stong pa nyid dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid dang / 'dus byas stong pa nyid dang /
translated: It is inner emptiness, outer emptiness, inner and outer emptiness, emptiness of emptiness, great emptiness, ultimate emptiness, emptiness of the conditioned,

original: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dang / mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid dang / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid dang / rang bzhin stong pa nyid dang / chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dang / mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid dang / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid dang / rang bzhin stong pa nyid dang / chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang /
translated: emptiness of the unconditioned, emptiness of what is beyond extremes, emptiness of what is without beginning or end, emptiness of nonrepudiation, emptiness of inherent natures, emptiness of all things,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa stong pa nyid dang / ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang / gzhan gyi ngo bo stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa stong pa nyid dang / ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang / gzhan gyi ngo bo stong pa nyid dang /
translated: emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics, emptiness of nonobservation, emptiness of nonentities, emptiness of essential nature, emptiness of the essential nature of nonentities, and emptiness of other entities.

original: chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin stong pa nyid gang yin pa de mi dmigs pa dang / chos thams cad brjod du med pa dang / tshig gi spyod yul ma yin pa'i bar gang yin pa 'di dag 'dus ma byas kyi chos nyid ces bya ba'o zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi don la mos pa chen po'i chung ngu yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin stong pa nyid gang yin pa de mi dmigs pa dang / chos thams cad brjod du med pa dang / tshig gi spyod yul ma yin pa'i bar gang yin pa 'di dag 'dus ma byas kyi chos nyid ces bya ba'o zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi don la mos pa chen po'i chung ngu yin no //
translated: The emptiness that is the nature of all phenomena is not apprehended, and all phenomena are inexpressible and not the domain of speech. These are called the unconditioned nature of phenomena.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to Śatakratu, head of the gods:

original: koo shi ka de de bzhin no //
analyzed: koo shi ka de de bzhin no //
translated: “Kauśika, that is so!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: That is so!

original: 'das pa'i dus su byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la brten te bla na med pa yang dag
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus su byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la brten te bla na med pa yang dag
translated: The tathāgatas, arhats, and samyaksaṃbuddhas who have appeared in the past, as many as there are, they too, Kauśika, have relied on this perfection of wisdom to fully awaken to unsurpassed,

original: par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //🔽ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la brten cing bla na med
analyzed: par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so // ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la brten cing bla na med
translated: the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the perfectly enlightened Buddha Śākyamuni, who has fully awakened to all phenomena in the three times, has also fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening by relying on this perfection of wisdom.🔽The tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas who are present, who exist, and who live right now in the world systems in the ten directions, as numerous as the sands of the River Ganges, they too, Kauśika, have fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening by relying on this perfection of wisdom.

original: pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas who will appear in the future, as many as there will be, they too will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening by relying on this very perfection of wisdom.

original: de ltar byung ba'i phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnams na de bzhin @90b gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyod ba dang / chos ston pa de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la brten cing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //🔽'das pa'i dus su byung ba dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus su byung ba dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas gang ji snyed pa de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la brten nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: de ltar byung ba'i phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnams na de bzhin @90b gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyod ba dang / chos ston pa de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la brten cing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so // 'das pa'i dus su byung ba dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus su byung ba dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas gang ji snyed pa de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la brten nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: And all the Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones, however many there are, who dwell in the world systems of the ten directions, who abide, live, and endure, and who teach the Dharma, they too, having relied on just this perfection of wisdom, have fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And all the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas who have appeared in the past, who will appear in the future, and who are appearing now, they too, having relied on just this perfection of wisdom, have fully awakened, will fully awaken, and are fully awakening to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: gang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par gyur to //
analyzed: gang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par gyur to //
translated: Those who have attained the fruit of entering the stream,

original: 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: will attain it,

original: gang yang lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid thob par gyur to //
analyzed: gang yang lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid thob par gyur to //
translated: those who have attained the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth,

original: 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: arhatship,🔽those who are now present in the innumerable world systems of the ten directions,

original: gang yang da ltar phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa dag na nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba de dag gis kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la brten te /
analyzed: gang yang da ltar phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa dag na nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas gang ji snyed cig bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba de dag gis kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la brten te /
translated: the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, will attain

original: nyan thos kyi byang chub dang / rang byang chub 'thob po //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi byang chub dang / rang byang chub 'thob po //
translated: the śrāvaka enlightenment and the pratyekabuddha enlightenment.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: de ni 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las theg pa gsum po thams cad kyang rgya cher bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las theg pa gsum po thams cad kyang rgya cher bstan pa ste /
translated: Because in this perfection of wisdom the three vehicles are taught in detail,

original: de dag kyang mtshan med pa'i tshul dang / skye ba med pa'i tshul dang / 'gag pa med pa'i tshul dang / kun nas nyo na mongs pa med pa'i tshul dang / rnam par byang ba med pa'i tshul dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'i tshul dang /
analyzed: de dag kyang mtshan med pa'i tshul dang / skye ba med pa'i tshul dang / 'gag pa med pa'i tshul dang / kun nas nyo na mongs pa med pa'i tshul dang / rnam par byang ba med pa'i tshul dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'i tshul dang /
translated: Moreover, it is by way of the mode of signlessness, the mode of non-production, the mode of non-cessation, the mode of the absence of afflictive emotion, the mode of the absence of purification, the mode of the absence of activity,

original: len pa med pa'i tshul dang / dor ba med pa'i tshul dang / dbri ba dang / bsnan pa med pa'i tshul dang / blang ba dang / spang ba med pa'i tshul gyis te /
analyzed: len pa med pa'i tshul dang / dor ba med pa'i tshul dang / dbri ba dang / bsnan pa med pa'i tshul dang / blang ba dang / spang ba med pa'i tshul gyis te /
translated: the mode of the absence of appropriation, the mode of the absence of rejection, the mode of the absence of increase and decrease, and the mode of the absence of acceptance and rejection.

original: de yang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du yin gyi don dam par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du yin gyi don dam par ni ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, that is by way of worldly convention, not by way of the ultimate.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di tshu rol lam /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di tshu rol lam /
translated: This perfection of wisdom is not this side,

original: pha rol lam /
analyzed: pha rol lam /
translated: nor is it the other side,

original: thang ngam gshong ngam /
analyzed: thang ngam gshong ngam /
translated: nor is it a plain, nor is it a valley,

original: mnyam pa'am / mi mnyam pa'am /
analyzed: mnyam pa'am / mi mnyam pa'am /
translated: nor is it even, nor is it uneven,

original: mtshan ma yod pa'am /
analyzed: mtshan ma yod pa'am /
translated: nor is it with signs,

original: mtshan ma med pa'am /🔽'jig rten pa'am /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'am / 'jig rten pa'am /
translated: nor is it signless,🔽nor is it worldly,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'am /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'am /
translated: nor is it beyond the world,

original: 'dus byas sam /
analyzed: 'dus byas sam /
translated: nor is it compounded,🔽nor is it uncompounded.

original: 'dus ma byas sam /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas sam /
translated: nor unconditioned,

original: dge pa'am / mi dge pa'am /
analyzed: dge pa'am / mi dge pa'am /
translated: nor virtuous, nor nonvirtuous,

original: 'das pa'am / ma 'ongs pa'am /
analyzed: 'das pa'am / ma 'ongs pa'am /
translated: nor past, nor future, nor present.

original: @91a * // da ltar byung bar btags pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: @91a * // da ltar byung bar btags pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is not designated.

original: koo shi ka shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ni chos gang yang rab tu ster bar byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: koo shi ka shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ni chos gang yang rab tu ster bar byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Kauśika, the perfection of wisdom does not bestow any dharma at all,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang / dgra bcom pa'i chos rnams rab tu ster bar byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi don la mos pa chen po'i 'bring yin no //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang / dgra bcom pa'i chos rnams rab tu ster bar byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi don la mos pa chen po'i 'bring yin no //
translated: nor does it bestow the dharmas of a pratyekabuddha, nor the dharmas of an arhat.” This is the medium great interest in the welfare of others.

original: brgya byin gyis gsol pa /🔽bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste /
analyzed: brgya byin gyis gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste /
translated: Śatakratu then said,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni pha rol tu phyin pa chen po ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni pha rol tu phyin pa chen po ste /
translated: “Blessed One, this perfection of wisdom is a great perfection.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'dir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa rnams sems can thams cad kyi sems dang spyod pa 'tshal kyang sems can du dmigs pa ma mchis so //🔽srog dang / gso bar ma mchis pa dang / skyes bur ma mchis /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'dir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa rnams sems can thams cad kyi sems dang spyod pa 'tshal kyang sems can du dmigs pa ma mchis so // srog dang / gso bar ma mchis pa dang / skyes bur ma mchis /
translated: Blessed One, here, when bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom know the minds and activities of all sentient beings, they do not apprehend sentient beings.

original: shed bur ma mchis /
analyzed: shed bur ma mchis /
translated: They do not apprehend a life-force, a nourished being, a man,🔽a human,

original: shed las skyes su ma mchis /
analyzed: shed las skyes su ma mchis /
translated: a human being,

original: byed pa por ma mchis /
analyzed: byed pa por ma mchis /
translated: an agent,

original: tshor ba por ma mchis /
analyzed: tshor ba por ma mchis /
translated: a feeler,

original: shes pa por ma mchis /🔽mthong ba por dmigs pa ma mchis so //
analyzed: shes pa por ma mchis / mthong ba por dmigs pa ma mchis so //
translated: a knower,🔽or a seer.

original: gzugs su dmigs pa ma mchis so //🔽tshor bar ma mchis so //
analyzed: gzugs su dmigs pa ma mchis so // tshor bar ma mchis so //
translated: They do not apprehend form.🔽They do not apprehend feeling,

original: 'du shes su ma mchis so //
analyzed: 'du shes su ma mchis so //
translated: perception,

original: 'du byed rnams su ma mchis so //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams su ma mchis so //
translated: or volitional factors.

original: rnam par shes par dmigs pa ma mchis so //
analyzed: rnam par shes par dmigs pa ma mchis so //
translated: They do not apprehend consciousness.

original: sa'i khams su dmigs pa ma mchis so //
analyzed: sa'i khams su dmigs pa ma mchis so //
translated: They do not apprehend the earth element.

original: chu'i khams su dmigs pa ma mchis so //
analyzed: chu'i khams su dmigs pa ma mchis so //
translated: They do not apprehend the water element.

original: me'i khams su dmigs pa ma mchis so //
analyzed: me'i khams su dmigs pa ma mchis so //
translated: They do not apprehend the fire element.

original: rlung gi khams su dmigs pa ma mchis so //
analyzed: rlung gi khams su dmigs pa ma mchis so //
translated: the wind element is non-apprehensible,

original: nam mkha'i khams su dmigs pa ma mchis so //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams su dmigs pa ma mchis so //
translated: the space element is non-apprehensible,

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams su dmigs pa ma mchis so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams su dmigs pa ma mchis so //
translated: and the consciousness element is non-apprehensible.

original: mig tu dmigs pa ma mchis so //
analyzed: mig tu dmigs pa ma mchis so //
translated: The eye is non-apprehensible,

original: gzugs su dmigs pa ma mchis so //
analyzed: gzugs su dmigs pa ma mchis so //
translated: form is non-apprehensible,🔽eye consciousness is non-apprehensible,

original: mig gi rnam par shes par dmigs pa ma mchis so //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes par dmigs pa ma mchis so //
translated: eye contact is non-apprehensible,🔽and any feeling that arises from the condition of eye contact, whether pleasant, painful, or neither painful nor pleasant, is also non-apprehensible.

original: mig gi 'dus te reg par dmigs pa ma mchis so //

original: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dang / chos su dmigs pa ma mchis so //
analyzed: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dang / chos su dmigs pa ma mchis so //
translated: mental phenomena are non-apprehensible,🔽mind consciousness is non-apprehensible,🔽mind contact is non-apprehensible,🔽and any feeling that arises from the condition of mind contact, whether pleasant, painful, or neither painful nor pleasant, is also non-apprehensible.

analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / mngon par shes pa drug tu dmigs pa ma mchis so ;

analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rnams su dmigs pa ma mchis so ;
